name: Valentin Imperial Maya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All arund this is a pretty good resort. We arrived on Jan 10th in the morning, we had to wait for our room (which was expected) but they gave us a chance to wander around to a get feel for the place. We had a Golden Junior suite in buidling 8, the great thing about this room we could hear the ocean and left our balcony door open at night. The food was what I would expect, everything was good but found at the staek house the meat to be excellent but the sides were cold. The beach and pool were fantastic. If you like quite go to the Golden section pool, if you like more of a party atmosphere go to the main pool.
reviews.title: Great Resort with One Little Hiccup

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: A couple of bad points....we unfortunately had to leave after our 4th due to an emergency. Finally we asked to Kalua once and it sis not taste like Kalua, more like a chearper coffe liquor. The second time my wife saw the bar tender pour from the Kalua bottle and the same thing it was not Kalua. Not sure what the deal was there never had time to inquiry.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That would not discourage me from going back though.
reviews.title: Wonderful trip and a great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The setup of the hotel is very good. It has a nice beach; the part of it has no rocks, so anybody can swim even if they have a red flag. The staff was going out of their way to please everybody. The service was exceptional! We stayed in junior suite, so the room was specious and the bathroom was very big. We did diving and we really liked our instructors - Victor and Raul. They were very helpful and accommodating.
reviews.title: Great people, great room, dinner so-so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good (not great), but we are from LA, so we are probably spoiled a little. I would not recommend the Japanese restaurant there. We had sushi there and I can't call it sushi at all. If you ever tasted the real sushi, you would know what I mean.
reviews.title: Great Time, Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time in Cancun and spent one week at this beautiful resort in January. This is quite a large resort with around 14 buildings or so of hotel rooms. The grounds are absolutely beautifully cared for and the iguanas and coatis are fun to watch when they come out to sun themselves and play. When we checked in, we were offered an upgrade at a discount, but after several minutes of my asking questions about it, they ended up offering it for free which was very appreciated and a nice bonus. It was a room in one of the beach buildings(13). It was on the first floor so it didn't have a view of the beach because of the vegetation buffer between the building and beach, but it was a quick walk down to the beach where we would take our room service coffee and enjoy the early morning view. It had quite a large jacuzzi tub that opened up to the outside which we would enjoy in the evening.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We typically went to the beach every day and had no problem getting drinks delivered to us at the very end of the beach - tipping a few bucks each round keeps them coming! Oh and like other comments, if you want top shelf liquor, you need to ask for it. We would go to the pool in the afternoon and enjoyed the "lazy river" pool the most - quieter and more chairs to be found there.
reviews.title: A wonderful two weeks at Riviera Maya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each evening we tried a different restaurant - menu items seemed to be hit or miss with comments from delicious to average. Our favorites were the italian(great gnocci with bolognese),french(great filet), indonesian(great pad thai), and mexican(great chips and salsas and flaming shrimp). We live in a resort area with awesome fresh fish, and after trying several of the fish offerings decided that the sea bass and the shrimp seemed the freshest(maybe most local). All the others seemed more processed or lacking in flavor. We typically ate at the buffet closest to the beach for breakfast and lunch - never had to wait, but sometimes would get the room service "Cafe American" with pastries and fruit plates.
reviews.title: An excellent five star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The service at this resort was excellent. The staff from the groundskeepers, maids to restaurant and bar staff are extremely well trained and seem to enjoy their jobs. They spoke English, were very personable and friendly. It was a memorable week at the Valentin Imperial Maya!!!
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Although we have been frequent visitors at Riviera Maya over the last few years,.It was our first stay at the Valentin Imperial Maya. The experience was very conclusive. It is a place to keep in mind for anyone wanting a vacation in the sun in that part of the world.
reviews.title: Near Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived and were greeted with "welcome home!" and it was like home, without the chores, in a fairy tail. Excellent service, food, room, spa, atmosphere and guests too. We first visited for our honeymoon 3 months after they first opened and it was amazing. We were scared to return in case they couldn't maintain our expectations, but last year we chanced it an were excited to find it to be still awesome. So for this anniversary, when deciding where to go, we didn't hesitate to return for our third visit. We miss our second home already and can't wait for our next visit.
reviews.title: 3rd visit in 5 years...perfect vacation again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those who are super party people, it may not be what you are looking for, but they do offer excursions to Coco Bongo and other activities.
reviews.title: Diamond Suite - Average Service, food and amenities, above average grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my third all inclusive hotel in Mexico. First of all, we originally booked the "Emerald Jr. Suite" - which was nice. However, we upgraded to the Diamond Suite upon check-in to receive the Premium Privilege package. It was very expensive and not really worth the upgrade. The food in the restaurants were average, certainly not what was advertised here on TripAdvisor. All in all, not my favorite destination, and I won't be back.
reviews.title: Great time for large group.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room -
reviews.title: Just the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Emerald Jr. Suite is like any standard American middle to upper class hotel, with a nice jacuzzi in the room. The suites that face the beach and are secluded. King size bed and nice sized shower.
reviews.title: Valentin Imperial Maya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Valentin for our 26th anniversary. We have not been on many vacations, however we are extreme foodies and I plan my vacations around where I want to eat. And usually that’s all I remember about my vacation was my memorable meals. This was our first resort type vacation. We are not people who love to be around crowds. I would rather not go anywhere than go on a cruise. And with those two things being said we were never once disappointed by The Valentin. We were told it was at 97% full and never once did we wait for a meal or feel we could not get a pool chair nor did we feel it was too loud or crowded. We were only staying 4 short days. We decided we didn’t want to overstay if we didn’t like the resort type vacation but we were so sorry when it came time to leave. We didn’t get to try half of the restaurants and were just figuring out how things worked when it was time to go. SO do yourself a favor & go for at least a week. We have already booked next year and I can’t wait. We stayed Jan 5-9 and the weather was the best. We just ended up with a regular room in Bldg 4. We loved it though. I was really hoping for an upgrade when we were there, they never offered, I asked but they didn’t really respond. I’m guessing because it was full. I loved the location of our building, close to everything. Rooms were clean & we noticed no damage, no smell. I never missed the upgraded rooms like I thought I would. We walked over to the beach front rooms. Although I could not see inside a room, I preferred our location & we were on the 3rd floor so we had a far away ocean view.
reviews.title: Our first time will not be our last

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My most favorite parts of the trip were the staff at Valentin. We loved all of them. What a great group of people. Elsie, Sonia, Juan Paolo…you made our trip fun. I wished I remembered everyone’s name. because we never came across someone we did not really enjoy. We had actually booked a photo session at Blue Lens , something we would normally not do, we were soooo soo glad we did. The people there were awesome, so nice. And our photo session was loads of fun and we have never had such great photos taken in our life. Definitely we were beyond happy with that. Juan Paolo was our photographer & what a lovely guy.
reviews.title: Great 2 week stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to the food. I read all reviews prior to going so I thought I knew what I was doing and where to go…I didn’t lol. I never found the sushi bar. Next time. And I find taste is all subjective so its hard to gauge. The Indonesian was our favorite. And we really enjoyed the lunch buffets just because we just ordered the cook in front of you fish & had ahi & shrimp every day, with salad or fruit. We were thrilled. If I could just take one of them home with me, I’d eat healthy every day. La Hacienda was our least favorite but I loved eating out on the patio with the water right there and Lobster pot was..eh. The crab salad was odd. But that’s my only complaint.
reviews.title: Lareg Resort, Intimate Feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved that they had vendors out at nighttime. We did take the shuttle to playa one afternoon but I ended up buying from the vendors more. Their prices were better. They weren’t pushy & a few artist there making their items right there is someone I’d rather support. Over commercialized items from China that are in playa stores.
reviews.title: wonderful property and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drinking part of the trip was so-so. It is ok for me, Im the worlds biggest lightweight & pass out on a half a drink. And only once did I feel buzzed which was at La Hacienda, I had a margarita. It was better than the pool ones by far & we were able to go get shots on the cart to add to our drink.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property

aka: Valentin Imperial Maya Hotel Playa Del Carmen
description: Hotel Valentin Imperial Maya is the new definition of paradise. Our 5 star Adults-Only (18+) All-Inclusive Resort is located a short 25 minutes from Cancun International Airport in the Riviera Maya.Set amid lavish gardens on a half-mile-long stretch of white sand beach named Playa Del Secreto (The Secret Beach), this magnificent award-winning resort boasts one of the largest swimming pools in México. The location is ideal as one can easily reach Cancun and the world famous Mayan archaeological sites such as Tulúm, Cobá, and Chichen Itzá, yet be removed enough to enjoy the casually elegant ambience of Valentin Imperial Maya.Escape into a world where your every wish is our command. Come indulge yourself….you deserve it!
